ThingDef.label: Calcite Crystal
ThingDef.description: Crystals of calcium carbonate. A common mineral found underground, particulary in limestone caves. Interesting, but not otherwise very useful. Yeilds rubble if mined.

ThingDef.Name: GoldPyriteCrystal
ThingDef.label: Pyrite Crystal
ThingDef.description: Crystals of iron(II) disulfide. A common mineral found underground and often mistaken for gold or silver by the foolish. Interesting, but not otherwise very useful. Yeilds rubble if mined.

ThingDef.Name: QuartzCrystal
ThingDef.label: Quartz Crystal
ThingDef.description: Crystals of silicon dioxide, the same material glass is made of. A common mineral found underground. Yeilds glass batch when mined. Once in a while a gem-quality peice might be found.

ThingDef.label: Amethyst Crystal
ThingDef.description: Crystals of silicon dioxide. Impurities of iron make these crystals a beautiful purple. A common mineral found underground. Yeilds glass batch when mined. Sometimes a gem-quality peice might be found.

ThingDef.label: Citrine Crystal
ThingDef.description: Crystals of silicon dioxide. Impurities of iron make these crystals a beautiful yellow. Rarely found. Yeilds glass batch when mined. Often yeilds gem-quality peices due to its interesting color.

ThingDef.label: Prasiolite Crystal
ThingDef.description: A very rare and beautiful green variety of quartz, silicon dioxide. Yeilds glass batch when mined. Often yeilds gem-quality peices due to its interesting color.

ThingDef.Name: Obsidian
ThingDef.label: Obsidian
ThingDef.description: A volcanic glass formed when lava cools quickly at the surface. Valued by the tribal inhabitants of this rimworld for making knifes, handaxes, and arrowheads.

ThingDef.Name: FlintNodule
ThingDef.label: Flint Nodule
ThingDef.description: Formations of microcrystalline silicon dioxide found in sedimentary rocks. Valued by the tribal inhabitants of this rimworld for making knifes, handaxes, and arrowheads.

ThingDef.Name: SchorlCrystal
ThingDef.label: Schorl Crystal
ThingDef.description: The most common and least valuable form of tourmaline, a boron silicate mineral.

ThingDef.label: Dravite Crystal
ThingDef.description: A type of tourmaline, a boron silicate mineral with many chemical variations. This tan variety sometimes yeilds gem-quality stones.

ThingDef.label: Rubellite Crystal
ThingDef.description: A type of tourmaline, a boron silicate mineral with many chemical variations. This red variety often yeilds high quality gemstones.

ThingDef.label: Indicolite Crystal
ThingDef.description: A type of tourmaline, a boron silicate mineral with many chemical variations. This blue-green variety often yeilds high quality gemstones.

ThingDef.label: Green Tourmaline Crystal
ThingDef.description: A rare type of tourmaline, a boron silicate mineral with many chemical variations. This green variety often yeilds high quality gemstones.

ThingDef.label: Siberite Crystal
ThingDef.description: A rare type of tourmaline, a boron silicate mineral with many chemical variations. This purple variety often yeilds high quality gemstones.

ThingDef.label: Watermelon Tourmaline Crystal
ThingDef.description: A very rare type of tourmaline, a boron silicate mineral with many chemical variations. This green and pink variety is prized for high quality gemstones.

ThingDef.Name: BigSulfurCrystal
ThingDef.label: Large Sulfur Crystals
ThingDef.description: Elemental sulfur crystals formed by volcanic gasses. These ones are quite large and the geologic conditions that created them have ceased long ago.

ThingDef.Name: MagnetiteCrystal
ThingDef.label: Magnetite Crystals
ThingDef.description: Formations of iron(II,III) oxide, a common iron ore in sedimentary and igenous rocks.

ThingDef.label: Lodestone
ThingDef.description: Formations of iron(II,III) oxide, a common iron ore in sedimentary and igenous rocks. This particular one seems to be the rare magnetized variety known as lodestone.

ThingDef.label: Cassiterite Crystals
ThingDef.description: Formations of tin oxide, a common ore of tin. Occasionally used for gem stones.

ThingDef.Name: CorundumCrystal
ThingDef.label: Corundum embedded in rock
ThingDef.description: Crystals of aluminium oxide embedded in rock. One of the hardest minerals and often cut into gems. Impurities often color corundum, but this patch is clear.

ThingDef.label: Rubies embedded in rock
ThingDef.description: Crystals of aluminium oxide embedded in rock. One of the hardest minerals and often cut into gems. Impurities of chromium color this patch is a deep red.

ThingDef.label: Sapphires embedded in rock
ThingDef.description: Crystals of aluminium oxide embedded in rock. One of the hardest minerals and often cut into gems. Impurities of iron color this patch is a deep blue.

ThingDef.label: Padparadschas embedded in rock
ThingDef.description: Crystals of aluminium oxide embedded in rock. One of the hardest minerals and often cut into gems. This is a very rare and valuable pink-orange variety.

ThingDef.Name: BerylCrystal
ThingDef.label: Goshenite embedded in rock
ThingDef.description: Crystals of beryl, a type of beryllium aluminium silicate, a rare mineral often used for gemstones. This variety is clear.

ThingDef.label: Emeralds embedded in rock
ThingDef.description: Crystals of beryl, a type of beryllium aluminium silicate, a rare mineral often used for gemstones. This variety is green due to trace impurities of chromium.

ThingDef.label: Aquamarine embedded in rock
ThingDef.description: Crystals of beryl, a type of beryllium aluminium silicate, a rare mineral often used for gemstones. This variety is light blue due to trace impurities of iron.

ThingDef.label: Heliodor embedded in rock
ThingDef.description: Crystals of beryl, a type of beryllium aluminium silicate, a rare mineral often used for gemstones. This rare variety is yellow due to trace impurities of iron.

ThingDef.label: Morganite embedded in rock
ThingDef.description: Crystals of beryl, a type of beryllium aluminium silicate, a rare mineral often used for gemstones. This rare variety is pink due to trace impurities of manganese.

ThingDef.label: Bixbite embedded in rock
ThingDef.description: Crystals of beryl, a type of beryllium aluminium silicate, a rare mineral often used for gemstones. This very rare variety is a deep red due to impurities of manganese. Unlike most types of beryl, this can be found in igneous rocks.

ThingDef.Name: DiamondCrystal
ThingDef.label: Diamonds embedded in rock
ThingDef.description: Crystals of pure carbon. The hardest known substance and a valuable gemstone.

ThingDef.Name: UraniniteDeposit
ThingDef.label: Uraninite Deposit
ThingDef.description: Formations of uranium oxide, a major uranium ore. Often assocaited with silver.

ThingDef.Name: MalachiteDeposit
ThingDef.label: Malachite Deposit
ThingDef.description: Beautiful green deposits of copper carbonate hydroxide, sometimes used for gemstone or a source of copper ore. Often found near copper ore, azurite, calcite, and limestone rock.

ThingDef.label: Azurite Deposit
ThingDef.description: Beautiful blue deposits of copper carbonate hydroxide, occasionally used for gemstones. Often found near copper ore, azurite, calcite, and limestone rock.
